action.action-desc: Mr. Jackson of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To eliminate taxpayer funding for the partisan broadcasting outlets known as National Public Radio and the Public Broadcasting Service, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Partisan Radio and Partisan Broadcasting Services Act or the NPR and PBS Act.

section.header: Prohibition on Federal funding for National Public Radio and Public Broadcasting Service

subsection.text: After the date of the enactment of this Act, no Federal funds may, directly or indirectly, be made available to or used to support an organization described in subsection (b), including through the payment of dues to or the purchase of programming from such organization by a public broadcast station using Federal funds received by such station.
The organizations described in this subsection areâ€”

paragraph.text: the organization known, as of the date of the enactment of this Act, as National Public Radio;
the organization known, as of the date of the enactment of this Act, as the Public Broadcasting Service; and
any successor organization to an organization described in paragraph (1) or (2).
